ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.

Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.

name: r-kde1d

about.summary: Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.1.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-kde1d
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/kde1d_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/kde1d/kde1d_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 70283d5e593b64d2e257c6c72aac5208f2eee5b221b3f3e4761268ce99c3221c

build:
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}                # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}          # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}      # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bh
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcppeigen
    - r-randtoolbox
  run:
    - r-base
    #- r-bh
    - r-rcpp
    - r-rcppeigen
    - r-randtoolbox

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('kde1d')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('kde1d')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/tnagler/kde1d
  license: MIT
  summary: Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - lbeziaud

# Package: kde1d
# Type: Package
# Title: Univariate Kernel Density Estimation
# Version: 1.0.4
# Authors@R: c( person("Thomas", "Nagler",, "mail@tnagler.com", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("Thibault", "Vatter",, "thibault.vatter@gmail.com", role = c("aut")) )
# Description: Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LinkingTo: BH, Rcpp, RcppEigen
# Imports: graphics, Rcpp, randtoolbox, stats, utils
# RoxygenNote: 7.1.2
# Suggests: testthat
# URL: https://github.com/tnagler/kde1d
# BugReports: https://github.com/tnagler/kde1d/issues
# SystemRequirements: C++11
# NeedsCompilation: yes
# Packaged: 2022-03-17 00:25:12 UTC; n5
# Author: Thomas Nagler [aut, cre], Thibault Vatter [aut]
# Maintainer: Thomas Nagler <mail@tnagler.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-03-17 00:50:02 UTC

about.summary: Provides an efficient implementation of univariate local polynomial kernel density estimators that can handle bounded and discrete data. See Geenens (2014) <arXiv:1303.4121>, Geenens and Wang (2018) <arXiv:1602.04862>, Nagler (2018a) <arXiv:1704.07457>, Nagler (2018b) <arXiv:1705.05431>.
